channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Streetlight outside number 19 is not working, 19th January
item.description:
Streetlight outside number 19 is not working, this streetlight was recently converted to charge EV's and this doesn't appear to be working either, the usual blue light they have is not illuminating.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Warwick Road, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Our black bins were not emptied at 112 wellmeadow road it is a household of three flats therefore there is no room to any rubbish within the next two weeks, 19th January
item.description:
Please can it be arranged for the black bins to be emptied
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellmeadow Road, Catford South, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light on Kent House Approach Not Working, 19th January
item.description:
The light in the centre of the Kent House Approach “island” in front of the train station entrance is not working. The asset number is K466. Please can you investigate and replace? Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Approach, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Light Still not working, 19th January
item.description:
This light appears to have been raised on a few occasions over the last 3 months. This light is making the road and surrounding garages and cark parks extremely dark. It is dark to the point where it is starting to attract people loitering around and using the area to eat takeaways before throwing the remains onto the street. This dark corner is starting to feel less safe, please fix this immediately.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Freelands Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole cluster, 19th January
item.description:
Outside 5 West Heath Avenue, exposing/shedding coarse rubble.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Heath Avenue, Golders Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rotting leaves & tree branches, 19th January
item.description:
At the base of many of the trees along Brook Lane, in the road and along some of the pavements there are rotting leaves and tree branches. Your annual leaf collecting programme doesn't appear to cover our road. Please remove them asap and keep our street clean.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Lane, Sundridge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cut down parking sign on Mycenae Road on Council land, 19th January
item.description:
The sign was apparently cut down by Kent Moling services to make way for their digger shelter when digging work was being done on the road in November. I don't know if that's what actually happened. At the time it was thrown over the wall on to the council owned land where the steps go up from Mycenae Road to Beaconsfield Court. Now it has been removed from there and left on the pavement.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mycenae Road, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen tree, 19th January
item.description:
Fallen tree needs replanting please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wickham Way, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree cutting flytipped, 19th January
item.description:
Local resident has dumped their tree cuttings on the pavement. Either number 3 or 4 drovers place. Easy to identigy tree type to whats in their garden.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leo Street, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rotting leaves covering yellow lines along the kerb, 19th January
item.description:
Hello, On woodland way there's about 20m of piled up rotting leaves along the kerbside, from the street oaktrer down to the lamppost. It's covering yellow lines and blocking drains. Been there for about 3 months so quite deep. Can this be cleared? Thankyou, kind regards

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodland Way, Petts Wood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Growing amounts of rubbish and urine, 19th January
item.description:
This issue has been reported a number of times and is getting increasingly worse each time. Something needs to be done to avoid this happening each time the mess is cleared. There are children living nearby and a food store, it’s a health hazard.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black bin left on pavement all the time, 19th January
item.description:
A black bin is always left on the pavement in this location. It is usually overflowing with rubbish. can the bin be removed and the flat occupier be told to put it in the correct area (not on the pavement)? None of the other flats leave bins here.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Middleton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excess bins blocking pavement, 19th January
item.description:
Outside 138 Dalyell Rd. More bin’s than there are properties. Orphan bins not belonging to any household. Reported multiple times to Lambeth.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dalyell Road, Brixton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Front garden dump, 19th January
item.description:
The front garden of 176B Langham Road N15 has become a growing rubbish dump. Which now presents a hazardous environment to all those who live nearby. The home owner needs to be fined and made to clear the growing dump.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 180, Langham Road, West Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
